ygData.subject: Exception in usage of BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy in Heritrix-2.0.0
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi All, I have been using Heritrix-2.0.0 for web-crawling. Recently i tried changing the Queue Assignment Policy from the default

From: Pratyush Banerjee <Pratyushbanerjee@...>
Subject: Exception in usage of BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy in Heritrix-2.0.0
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=340369307


----------MB_8CA7CE1D93C646B_FE8_6F03_webmail-dd14.sysops.aol.com
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"

Hi All,

I have been using Heritrix-2.0.0 for web-crawling. Recently i tried changing the Queue Assignment Policy from the default 
SurtAuthorityQueueAssignmentPolicy to BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy. 

However after configuring the job when i am trying to launch my job then it throws an exception saying 

java.lang.RuntimeException: org.archive.state.UnregisteredKeyException: Unregistered key in class org.archive.crawler.frontier.BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy; 

There are two separate places in the web-UI where once can change the policy. I have tried using both or one or the other with no results. 
In every case the same error occurs. 

I also tried registering the? keys using KeyManager.addKeys( org.archive.crawler.frontier.BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy.class) but it throws up an exception saying invalid keys for the class. 

Am i doing something wrong or missing some other Key Settings or its a bug with the code. It would be greatly helpful to know how i can make this work. 

Please find the log attached below.

<font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">Hi All,<br>
<br>
I have been using Heritrix-2.0.0 for web-crawling. Recently i tried changing the Queue Assignment Policy from the default <br>
SurtAuthorityQueueAssignmentPolicy to BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy. <br>
<br>
However after configuring the job when i am trying to launch my job then it throws an exception saying <br>
<br>
<font face="Courier New, Courier, mono">java.lang.RuntimeException: org.archive.state.UnregisteredKeyException: Unregistered key in class org.archive.crawler.frontier.BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy; <br>
<br>
<font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">There are two separate places in the web-UI where once can change the policy. I have tried using both or one or the other with no results. <br>
In every case the same error occurs. <br>
<br>
I also tried registering the  keys using KeyManager.addKeys( o</font></font></font><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><font face="Courier New, Courier, mono"><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">rg.archive.crawler.frontier.BucketQueueAssignmentPolicy.class) but it throws up an exception saying invalid keys for the class. <br>
<br>
Am i doing something wrong or missing some other Key Settings or its a bug with the code. It would be greatly helpful to know how i can make this work. <br>
<br>
Please find the log attached below. <br>
<br>
